fields.commentText: I am having the exact same issue.

I totally relate. I've started blocking out “focus time” in the morning when the house is quieter. Even though I have baby-related tasks on my mind, I try to keep emails and meetings separate. It helps me feel a bit more organized.

Great suggestion. I’m also using a shared family calendar with my partner, which includes my work meetings and baby appointments. This way, we avoid scheduling conflicts and ensure one of us is always on baby duty during peak work hours.
Thanks, everyone! I like the idea of a shared calendar and iv'e also decided to set up a dedicated workspace. I’m going to try a few of these strategies to see what best fits our routine.

I've been there, RTH! What helped me was establishing a consistent bedtime routine—bath, book, and a lullaby always work like a charm. I noticed that after a few nights, my baby started to associate the routine with sleep.

I experimented with swaddling and it made a huge difference. The secure feeling can really mimic the comfort of the womb. Also, don't underestimate the power of a dim room—lighting really plays a role in setting the mood for sleep.
maybe a little bit of whisky on the dummy?

Thanks for (most) of the suggestions! I'm going to try establishing a stricter bedtime routine and maybe adding some white noise into the mix. It's a bit of trial and error, but I'm hopeful something will click soon.

I just stumbled on this. Hope it helps.
